ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
- More accurate use of advanced Chinese Grammar
- Wider intermediate Chinese vocabulary
- Fluency and comfort while conducting Chinese conversations and presentations
I developed many skills in speaking, listening and writing in Chinese
I gained a deep understanding of the Chinese language and culture.
Learned more chinese sentence structures, vocabulary and became more fluent in being able to express myself in Chinese.

I gained the tools needed in order to further my speaking, writing, and conversational skills in Chinese. Through this extremely structured course, I was able to gain these insights while simultaneously gaining knowledge of Chinese culture.
I improved my Chinese grammar, speaking and listening skills.
I improved my knowledge of Chinese a lot! The course is great despite being intense and homework-heavy. Highly recommend to anyone who is not afraid of challenges and wants to improve their Chinese.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: rigorous course, very much improves your Mandarin writing abilities, incredible (retweet incredible) faculty
Weaknesses: 90% of grade is determined off of written exams / homework assignments, only 10% of grade is based on actual listening and speaking skills, several assignments that didn't seem meaningful and required memorization instead of learning

Strengths: 
- Ao Laoshi is a rockstar teacher. She ensures that every one in the class practices speaking chinese, corrects mistakes in a constructive way. Her energy and enthusiasm make the daily class a delight. I wish I could have her next semester. 
- Rigorous curriculum that leads to significant improvement 
- Structured curriculum - learning the vocab associated with a passage in the chapter, and reinforcing it with vocab, grammar and listening quizzes
- Assessment balanced throughout the semester

Weaknesses
- Unfair deadline of 9am for all courses (i.e., the 9:35am course gets more time to complete assessments than the 11:35am course). 
- On occasion, the daily homework is unevenly balanced. E.g., reading an essay, doing vocab and writing an essay in one day. This is rare, but it would be good to avoid allocating so many tasks to one day
- Listening tests have poor quality recordings that 'skip', so they can be hard to hear
- Kouyu tests are too short and don't reflect actual conversations. The way to do well is to just memorise a response to a question, which doesn't encourage an ongoing conversation

Great syllabus, Great organization, Great professors.

No improvements
Strengths: the class was very engaging and I got to know my teacher and fellow students quite well. It was also easier to get one on one help if needed.

Strengths: a well-organised, clear program with incredible professors. 
Weaknesses: very little. this course is incredible.

This course is extremely well put together and structured for students of all types of Chinese skill backgrounds. It was very engaging, with the department selecting assignments that both allowed us to improve our Chinese and engage us further in Chinese culture.
This course focuses a lot on reading, and not as much on writing, listening, or speaking.

Strengths: Intimate and engaging environment, very supportive teachers, a very well-organized curriculum.
Weaknesses: Asynchronous classes and ebook projects at the end of the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you're really into learning Chinese
Yes. The workload is high, but it is the course I have learnt the most in.
I would absolutely recommend this course, the Ao laoshi made the teaching environment feel like home making learning the language very easy.
Yes. A thousand times yes. The most progress Ive made thus far in Chinese. Ao Laoshi is incredible.
Yes if you really want to learn the language and learn more about culture in China.
100%. This class was a true community with a great professor that greatly improved my Chinese speaking / listening and writing skills.

I would absolutely recommend any student interested in learning a new language to take Chinese. Yale's Chinese department is not only focused on academic rigor, but also focused on making the learning experience a community effort within the classroom.
Absolutely! If you want to improve your Chinese, this is definitely the course for you!
